metadata.title: CVE-2018-12127 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - high
metadata.description:
Microarchitectural Load Port Data Sampling (MLPDS): Load ports on somemicroprocessors utilizing speculative execution may allow an authenticateduser to potentially enable information disclosure via a side channel withlocal access. A list of impacted products can be found here:https://www.intel.com/content/dam/www/public/us/en/documents/corporate-information/SA00233-microcode-update-guidance_05132019.pdf

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12127` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

intel-microcode - 3.20190514.0ubuntu1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic-lpae - 5.13.0-19.19

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.20190514.0ubuntu1').
linux package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.13.0-19.19').
linux-aws package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.13.0-1005.6').
linux-gke package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.13.0-1006.7').
linux-gcp package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.13.0-1005.6').
linux-kvm package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.13.0-1004.4').
linux-oracle package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.13.0-1008.10').
qemu package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4').
libvirt package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1ubuntu4').
linux-raspi package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.13.0-1008.9').
linux-gkeop package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
linux-ibm package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1002.2').
linux-azure-fde package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lowlatency package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-22.22').
linux-oem-5.17 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.17.0-1003.3').
linux-intel-iotg package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1004.6').
linux-oem-6.0 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.0-1006.6').
